alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ocean and eastern Monmouth Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 545 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Point Pleasant Beach, or 8 miles northeast of Toms River, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Lakewood, Middletown, Howell, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Manasquan, Highlands, Point Pleasant Beach, Seaside Heights, Farmingdale, Mantoloking, Allenwood, Elberon, Navesink and Brick Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 29 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 87 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Western Monmouth
